docs.lead_paragraph: THEY once seemed like technological marvels: "600 tiny time pills" packed inside a cold tablet and programmed to release a set amount of medicine into the body for 12 hours. But last week a group of doctors meeting in New York proclaimed that the sun was setting on this shotgun approach to drug dosing and dawning on an age of drugs that are precisely timed to enter the bloodstream when they are needed most. They said these new "smart drugs" would be timed to go to work when they could provide the greatest benefit and to leave when their services were no longer necessary, so as to cause the fewest side effects.

headline.main: New Drugs Are Precisely Timed To Match Body's Biological Clock

docs.lead_paragraph: Acting unusually quickly, the Food and Drug Administration yesterday approved a new drug to treat AIDS, the second one of a promising new class of drugs. The new drugs, called protease inhibitors, appear to be very effective, but are expensive and show the best results when they are used in combination with other AIDS drugs, which are also expensive. President Clinton said he would ask Congress for $52 million more in money to pay for prescriptions for the new drugs and drug combinations for those who cannot pay for them.

headline.main: Drug Agency Acts Quickly On New Therapy for AIDS

docs.snippet: Acting unusually quickly, the Food and Drug Administration yesterday approved a new drug to treat AIDS, the second one of a promising new class of drugs.         The new drugs, called protease inhibitors, appear to be very effective, but are...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration announced yesterday that it would require all enriched foods to be fortified with folic acid, a vitamin that can prevent a common and devastating type of birth defect. The fortification requirement, which will involve most flours, corn meals, pasta and rice, will take effect on Jan. 1, 1998. The Federal agency said it was the first new fortification of foods since 1943, when vitamins and iron were added to enriched flour. And it is the first time that foods will be fortified to prevent a birth defect.

headline.main: Vitamin to Protect Fetuses Will Be Required in Foods
